SEARCH
Module LabAssignment
Package control

Class AuthService

java.lang.Object
control.AuthService
public class AuthService extends Object
Service class responsible for user authentication and credential management. Handles login verification against the repository, including specific checks for Company Representative authorization status, and handles password updates.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Class

    AuthService.AuthException
    Custom exception thrown when an authentication or authorization check fails.

  • Constructor Details

    • AuthService

      public AuthService(UserLookupRepository lookup, UserWriteRepository write)
      Constructs a new AuthService.
      Parameters:
      lookup - The repository used to find users by ID.
      write - The repository used to persist user data (e.g., updated passwords).

  • Method Details

    • authenticate

      public User authenticate(String userId, String rawPassword) throws AuthService.AuthException
      Authenticates a user based on their ID and password. Performs validation checks for:
      • Empty credentials.
      • Invalid User ID.
      • Incorrect Password.
      • Company Representative authorization status (must be approved by staff).
      Parameters:
      userId - The unique identifier of the user.
      rawPassword - The plain-text password input.
      Returns:
      The authenticated User object.
      Throws:
      AuthService.AuthException - If any validation check fails.

    • changePassword

      public void changePassword(String userId, String oldPwd, String newPwd) throws AuthService.AuthException
      Updates a user's password. Validates that the old password is correct and that the new password is different from the old one.
      Parameters:
      userId - The unique identifier of the user.
      oldPwd - The current password (for verification).
      newPwd - The new password to set.
      Throws:
      AuthService.AuthException - If fields are empty, user not found, old password incorrect, or new password matches the old one.
